newsitem.title: Switzerland: TENNIS-HINGIS THROUGH AT THE DOUBLE.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-HINGIS THROUGH AT THE DOUBLE.

text.p: Teenager Martina Hingis left home fans gasping as she sped into the European indoor championship semifinals on Friday.
Swiss followers who have packed the Saalsporthalle for each of the 16-year-old's matches have witnessed less than one hour's action in each of her three appearances.
This time they were seated for only 55 minutes as Hingis despatched Sabine Appelmans 6-3 6-1.
"I have confidence I never had before," said Hingis, who might have picked up a few pointers on a fast delivery during her visit to the Sauber Formula One team on Thursday.
"This confidence, it all started with my doubles victory at Wimbledon and grew reaching the semifinals at the U.S. Open and winning last week in Filderstadt.
"I'm hitting the ball so well now I feel I can do anything."
Despite the one-sided score Appelmans broke Hingis's opening serve on way to a 3-1 first set lead.
But from that point on the fifth-seeded Swiss took complete control and won 11 of the next 12 games.
The victory set up a rematch of last week's final in Filderstadt against Germany's Anke Huber.
Third seed Huber made the last four with an equally impressive 6-1 6-1 win over Italy's Silvia Farina.
The other semifinal pits second seed Iva Majoli of Croatia against fourth seed Jana Novotna of the Czech Republic.
Novotna advanced with a 6-4 6-2 triumph over Jennifer Capriati, denying the American her first semifinal appearance in three years.
Capriati, who has spent the last two years battling back from confrontations with the law, drug abuse and injury, has not made the last four of a tournament since the 1993 Canadian Open.
Bothered by tendinitis in her right elbow, the American struggled with her serve the entire match, holding it only once.
Novotna also had trouble as Capriati broke her five times.
"I just wasn't going for it like I was in my earlier matches," said Capriati "I was hesitant and she took advantage of it."
Holder Majoli eliminated sixth seed Brenda Schultz-McCarthy of the Netherlands 6-3 7-6.
